attributes.action: Fund a student railway discount card to lower costs
attributes.background: I am 17 years old, and I have to pay £6.70 a day to just get to school. This isn’t even including the cost of getting home. Why should I have to pay such an extortionate amount of money to go somewhere that I have to be by law?

attributes.action: To increase funding to Citizens Advice
attributes.background: With the growing demand on Citizens Advice and closure of other organisations. This means bigger work loads with reduced funding. To provide a more comprehensive service Citizens Advice need more funding

attributes.action: Mandatory 10 year custodial sentence for people caught carrying a knife.
attributes.background: Too often we hear of the devastating effects knife crime is having on peoples lives. Families losing loved ones to cowardly attacks by malicious gangs and individuals who use knives to kill or harm others. There does not appear to be enough of a deterrent to stop this behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
Early in the last century in Glasgow, Razor Gangs were rife, cutting and slashing each other with cut throat razors. In the 1950's this behaviour had started to raise its ugly head yet again. The Judge Lord Carmont at that time saw it fit to issue 10 year sentences to those caught carrying. The impact on this crime was almost instantaneous and the Razor Gangs soon phased out.

It is also well documented that by carrying a knife that person is more likely to be a victim of a stabbing.

attributes.action: Everyone breeding puppies must have a licence linked to the puppy's microchip.
attributes.background: Dog breeders must all obtain a licence to breed. All litters and puppies should be listed onto a national database. All puppies must carry the licence details linked to their chip. No puppy should be sold without a chip, a licence certificate and a national database number.
attributes.additional_details: If this system were introduced then linked to a (heavily reformed) Dangerous Dogs Act and a health monitoring system, breeders who persistently bred litters with poor temperaments or health problems could be identified and have their licences revoked. In one fell swoop this would put puppy farmers out of business almost overnight, help to solve the problem of health defects being bred into or promoted in some breeds and improve the quality and temperament of puppies for family pet homes.

attributes.action: Award World War 2 Veterans a medal
attributes.background: We the undersigned request that HM Government issue a medal or other symbol of recognition to World War 2 Veterans on the 75th Anniversary of the ending of World War 2 in 2020.

attributes.action: Charge for Missed NHS Appointments
attributes.background:
Whatever we think about our NHS, it is there for us all, day and night. But it is in trouble and something has to change. 
If we don’t respect it, we will lose it.  
£300 million pounds are lost in Missed Appointments. Charging for these would reduce DNA’s and create income.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent government survey showed 10 million GP Appointments are missed every year. 
This equates to £300 million pounds. 
If a £20 charge was made £200 million could be saved and the privilege of getting an appointment would be more respected. 
More Appointments would either be kept or would incur a no show cancellation charge as it in the private sector. If we do nothing to save our NHS, nothing will change. Please sign and share.

attributes.action: To increase the length of imprisonment for Voyeurism to a minimum of 2 years.
attributes.background: Victims who are put through this vile offence are life changing, physically and mentally. Their ability to trust is taken away & yet the offender will only receive a maximum of 2 years imprisonment - with a 3rd off if they plead guilty. This is not in anyway justice for victims.
attributes.additional_details:
Voyeurism is an offence under the Sexual Offences Act 2003.

This offence consists of somebody watching/filming victims doing a private act without their consent. This can then be distributed over fake porn sites, social media and across the internet for others sexual needs. 2 years is not justice!

A private act can be from bathing, using a toilet, anything you would deem as private and personal, and people do not deserve to have their privacy taken and publicly distributed without knowing.

attributes.action: Change the crime of killing by drink driving to manslaughter.
attributes.background:
My dad at 13 years old lost his mother because someone got behind the wheel after drinking. This person served less than 3 years in prison.
Drink driving fits the definition of manslaughter, they may mean no malice but knowing the risk still choose to drive, so should be punished accordingly.
attributes.additional_details:
Causing death due to drink driving in the UK is sentenced as death by dangerous driving. The average custodial sentence for causing death by careless/dangerous driving was just under four years in 2015.
240 times a year someone is killed by a drink driver in the UK. This means nearly 5 times a week someone in the UK loses their mom, dad, child, partner or friend.
Being in a vehicle makes their sentence more lenient than manslaughter. That is not justice for those who lose their lives.

attributes.action: Stop bank debit/credit card fees on letting agents who take money for clients
attributes.background: The credit/debit card fee ban starts 13 January - banks still charge a fee for card use. Banks make £billions yet small letting agents regularly receive money on behalf of clients and will now lose  money by just receiving client money.  It will impact tenants as companies will not accept cards.

attributes.action: Introduce fairer funding for schools in Yorkshire via a ‘Yorkshire Challenge’
attributes.background: In 2016 an IPPR study found that northern secondary schools received over £1,300 less per pupil than their London equivalent and primary schools suffer a £900 per pupil gap. At the time of releasing the figures IPPR North called upon the Government to address this via a ‘Powerhouse premium’.
attributes.additional_details: The turn around in London academic achievement since the ‘London Challenge’ has driven the number of pupils in the capital with five GCSE A to C grades to over 60%. It can be argued that a premium investment is made into London due to higher living costs but the IPPR North study found this to be not the case, in fact it found that northern schools should receive compensation for having a harder job than those in London. It is time for Yorkshire to have a ‘Yorkshire Challenge’ and fair funding.

attributes.action: Get schools to teach life skills and how to handle emotions
attributes.background: Schools need to teach children more about how to handle their emotions. Talking to children about what to do with their feelings and how to express them without causing themselves harm. Also life skills, like managing money, building a career and learning how to start a life as an adult.
attributes.additional_details:
When leaving school, you have your grades, you have big plans about going to university and starting a life as an individual. But are schools teaching children what and where to go next? NO!
They don’t teach children what to do when they feel depressed, upset or handle their emotions. Self harm and suicide is on the rise! Schools can help this! 
They don’t teach children how to look into property and buying a house,  pay a bill and setting up direct debts. They NEED to teach life skills.

attributes.action: the UK calls on the Turkish government to cease its military attacks on Afrin.
attributes.background:
I'm writing to you with regard to the worrying developments in Afrin, in northern Syria following the intervention of the Turkish military. 
A distressing situation has resulted from the heavy, indiscriminate bombing by the Turkish jets and artillery in heavily populated civilian areas in Afrin.
attributes.additional_details:
For years Afrin had been the safe haven for thousands of refugees who fled from neighboring cities and towns during the tragic civil war in Syria.
Remembering the tragedy of Kobane, no one would want to happen again in Afrin. 
I urge you to take up this matter with fellow members of the UK Parliament, who should demand that the UK government calls on the Turkish government to cease its military attacks on Afrin. 
Thank you in anticipation of your urgent attention to this matter.

Yours sincerely

attributes.action: Cut Foreign aid by half and use the £6.5 billion saved for the homeless.
attributes.background: Lets cut Foreign aid by half and use the £6.5 billion saved to get homeless people off the streets, into rehabilitation (where needed), and into houses and jobs.

attributes.action: The Government must fully protect the UK's fishing rights in talks with the EU.
attributes.background: Michael Gove “One of the things about leaving the EU is it means we’re free of the Common Agricultural Policy, free of the Common Fisheries Policy, able to have higher environmental and higher animal welfare standards." Mrs May.. “When we leave the EU, we will be leaving the Common Fisheries Policy.
attributes.additional_details:
From the Daily Express Newspaper. 

"EU officials appear to be targeting the UK’s fishing rights and want to use that as a bargaining chip in the talks in return for progress in other areas where Britain would require market access.

One unnamed EU diplomat told the Financial Times: “The UK government will ultimately need to decide how much it wants to pay to make the fish dream come true.”

attributes.action: The environment to be taught as a compulsory subject throughout school life.
attributes.background: All the good we do now with regards to litter picking, recycling, and on environmental issues will be a complete waste of time if we do not start to educate everyone from the year dot. We need to stop the rot so that our future generations will make a better job of looking after our world.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the people reading this will never have known what it is like to be brought up in a clean and pristine country. If we want to change this for our future generations we have to start NOW, and as with everything in life it begins with education. Many children are shown and taught to do the right thing before they start school, sadly many more are not because their parents themselves were not taught. We urgently need to stop this repetitive cycle which is why l have started this petition.

attributes.action: Get Deaf Road Warning signs onto our streets.
attributes.background: I am the mother of a 9 year-old profoundly Deaf boy. It struck me when visiting Europe and my family in the US that many countries and states have Deaf road warning signs in areas near schools with Deaf children and young adults, as well as in the vicinity of homes with Deaf families.
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 1 in every 1000 children is born with a severe or profound hearing loss. There are 11 million people with hearing loss across the UK, around one in six of the population. Deafness is the third most common disability in the world but you probably wouldn't spot a Deaf person in a crowd or know that a pedestrian has hearing loss.
The DSA handbook has warning signs for many things, deer crossing elderly people, schools and so on. A Deaf road warning sign is a glaring omission.

attributes.action: Failure to pay a County Court Judgement results in a criminal offence.
attributes.background: I won a CCJ in civil dispute case. I was awarded £10,410.88. They failed to pay by the deadline summonsed by Court. High Court bailiffs have failed to retrieve the funds. This can happen to anyone. There is no protection in a civil dispute. I want the law to change to protect the public.

attributes.action: Change the eligibility criteria of carers allowance.
attributes.background: I believe that someone who cares for someone else shouldn’t be denied by criteria from seeking other employment, studying or trying their best to continue living their lives.
attributes.additional_details: A person caring for a disabled person 35+hrs a week can apply for carers allowance (CA) provided you meet certain criteria. You can’t be under 16.  A 2010 BBC survey estimated 700k young carers who though they may care for 35hrs+ a week aren’t entitled to CA.  You can’t be in full time education or study for 21hrs a week - if you attend school, college or Uni you aren’t entitled to CA.  You can’t earn more than £120 a week. & receive CA. The system ignores care outside normal working hours.

attributes.action: Vote for whether there should be another EU referendum
attributes.background: HM Government says that if there is another referendum, then Democracy is broken. Therefore, I am calling for a vote on whether another referendum should take place, which means Democracy is not broken as the people have chosen to have another referendum if it is voted for.
attributes.additional_details: This means that the government must hold another referendum as the people of the nation voted for it, and must not neglect democracy. Lies were made in the campaign for Brexit, and politicians have not been held accounted for that. I personally believe that false hope does not represent democracy and there was no transparency. Furthermore, the people did not know what they voted for and they have the right to vote again, now they understand consequences. You must ask the people to vote again.

attributes.action: Stop discrimination against people on housing benefit or with pets
attributes.background: Stop landlords & letting agencies from discriminating against people for being on housing benefits or having pets. There are NOT enough council properties so we are forced to look into the private rent sector, only then to be told constantly NO because you are on housing benefits or you have a pet.
attributes.additional_details: I am on housing benefit for health reasons, no other, yet I feel I am tarnished and placed into that bracket of what people call "benefit scroungers". If I could swap with a fully fit person and be able to work for my own money again then believe me I would. Unfortunately this is the life I have been dealt with so I have to get on with it. That is why I am trying to build a better life, find a home suitable for me and my daughter to live in, but I keep coming up against this same brick wall.

attributes.action: Make rail season tickets tax deductible for those on PAYE
attributes.background:
Presently individuals who pay tax via PAYE pay tax on the income earned to fund their rail season ticket.
 
It seems unjust that someone should have to pay taxation on income earned to fund a season ticked purchased for the purpose of commuting to work.

attributes.action: Provide more government funding to help our struggling hospices to survive.
attributes.background: Sue Ryder Foundation have said they are closing their hospice at Nettlebed. The local community are about to lose a much loved facility which in a unique way has provided help and support to cancer victims and their families for many years.

attributes.action: Making it law to label foods containing group 1 carcinogens with warnings.
attributes.background:
Group 1 carcinogens are know to cause cancer like cigarettes for example.

Most people do not know that group 1 carcinogens are in many common foods.

A label stating that the product contains group 1 carcinogens gives the consumer the awareness and power to make a more informed choice.
attributes.additional_details:
As stated by WHO;

Cancer prevention
Between 30-50% of all cancer cases are preventable. Prevention offers the most cost-effective long-term strategy for the control of cancer. National policies and programmes should be implemented to raise awareness, to reduce exposure to cancer risk factors and to ensure that people are provided with the information and support they need to adopt healthy lifestyles.

http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs297/en/

attributes.action: Amend Equality Act 2010 by adding a provision for "Other" characteristics.
attributes.background: Change discrimination legislation, by adding another protected characteristic to the Equality Act 2010, namely "Other": a characteristic not included in the act but including traits/features/qualities, which could potentially attract discriminatory behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the only characteristics on which it is unlawful to discriminate are age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation and pregnancy/maternity. 
However, there is no recourse for people discriminated because of their weight, tattoos or sociocultural affiliation. This petition aims to change this by adding an “Other” option and thus not allowing people to be discriminated because of who they are within the rigid boundaries of the law, to be determined by Judges upon hearing and reading the evidence.

attributes.action: Make medical/ psychological support accessible for veterans in the UK a priority
attributes.background: Services currently provided for ex service personnel with PTSD does not meet their psychological needs leading to increased distress family breadowns and higher suicides
attributes.additional_details: Many of our service and veteran personnel suffer with crippling psychological damage often alone with their families trying to pick up the pieces alone. If we truly value the sacrifices our troops made for our country then we need to be prepared to provide the psychological support and welfare  they need to recover. Practitioners with experience and knowledge of PTSD linked to service rather than generalists who have no experience of combat stress.This has to be a priority of a civilised society

attributes.action: stop charging the public 15p to call the non-emergency 101 line
attributes.background: young man knocking on my door at 1.15am. Tried ringing 999. when man walked off rang local police station and was told to ring 101 which I did. After 15 minutes with no reply rang off but was charged 15p. I think it wrong that we are charged for ringing the police

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to ban the practice of killing dogs inhumanly
attributes.background:
Thousands of dogs are annually tortured to death during the Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, boiled to death, beaten, burned and dismembered while still alive. 

Yulin began in 2009; it is not tradition. Nor is there a valid comparison bet

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the Afghan Campaign, particularly Helmand.
attributes.background: The Iraq war started in Mar 03, ending Apr 09. 2 months later the PM announced an inquiry that took 6 yrs.  The Afghan conflict lasted 13 yrs, so a similar inquiry might last 15 yrs, meaning it might report ~30 years after the start of the conflict.  It is time for an inquiry.
attributes.additional_details:
Current UK Defence Doctrine (JDP 0-01, 5th edition),  shows the First Principle of War to be, (as it has been for years) the "Selection and Maintenance of the Aim".

Expanding into Helmand, to destroy poppies, open markets and allow girls to go to school, whilst noble, ignored this principle and the UK death toll rose from 6 to 457.

The MOD refuse, citing an ongoing training task. More evidence is on Parliament's website: https://www.parliament.uk/documents/180508%20Chair%20to%20PM%20re%20Afganistan%20with%20letter%20from%20R%20Hollington.pdf

attributes.action: Issue guidance to make employers aware of their duties to menopausal workers.
attributes.background: To recognise and address menopause within the workplace and ensure support measures are in place, also to be aware of the impacts that it may have upon an individual and their overall health and wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact upon an individual during the menopause can be quite disabling which can affect the biopsychosocial aspects of our lives.

If a female is not supported in the workplace they may lose their confidence, social skills, their finances and their job, the loss to an employer can be huge, this is in terms of how much experience, knowledge and skills an individual may have and are valuable assets to a company, which could be unnecessarily lost due to lack of care and support.

attributes.action: I want the employees' contracts with zero hours to disappear.
attributes.background:
I want the employees' contracts with zero hours to disappear.
Staff recruitment agencies and companies should be sanctioned if they do not hand over to employees the minimum work contract signed and job description.
attributes.additional_details: I want a normative act that clearly stipulates that work contracts with font size of rights and obligations, terms and conditions of minimum 10 and not written in very small letters, in order not to violate the employee's right to correct, complete and accurate information.

attributes.action: Goverment move security council resolution condemning Turkish Invasion of Syria.
attributes.background:
Turkey have undertaken Air strikes and sent in Troops to Kurdish areas of Syria causing major loss of life.
The UK Goverment must use the UN Security Council to put a resolution condemning this invasion and calling for Turkey’s immediate withdrawal and halting of all military action in Syria.

attributes.action: Remove known sex offenders from area where victim lives
attributes.background: Convicted child sex offenders should not be allowed in the area where their victims live. Children who are sexually assaulted suffer - reliving the incident, not being able to sleep at night and having nightmares about the sex offender coming back.
attributes.additional_details: A sex offender recently got a suspended sentence, time in rehab and 10 years on the sexual offenders register. The judge just allowed him to go home, in the same area as his victim. This is utterly unacceptable. Little children deserve not to live in fear!

attributes.action: Make 14 June 2018 a national day of mourning.
attributes.background: The appalling Grenfell Tower fire of 14 June 2017 deserves a fitting nationwide commemoration.

attributes.action: Waive liability of dog owners when an intruder is attacked in the home.
attributes.background: It seems there is a lot of confusion and unclear legislation regarding ‘liability’ if an intruder is bitten by a dog in the dogs home? This needs clarifying urgently along with clarity in respect to signage placed at the property, it should also be legislated in the view of protecting non criminals.
attributes.additional_details: A dog is naturally territorial although a lot of breeds, usually smaller would not attack an intruder due to size difference, a lot of perfectly well rounded large breeds would indeed feel threatened by an intruder entering ‘their’ secure territory. I am an ex British Army dog handler and find it abhorrent that the government cannot back up its citizens in a way they should. A person can be educated on the laws of ‘minimum force deemed necessary’ but how do you teach a dog not to defend itself.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on HS2. Give the public the vote like we had for Brexit.
attributes.background: HS2 is expected to cost £50+billion, not to mention the mess and impact it will make on our countryside, wildlife and nature. At present our NHS, emergency services, social services, affordable housing is in disarray. We were given a referendum on Brexit which will affect us all so why not HS2?
attributes.additional_details: Having undertaken a great deal of research into the pro's & con's of this project, attended HS2 facilitated meetings, researched the impact nationally that this will bring I can't help but feel that even though Royal assent has been given its not to late to allow the public to vote on whether this project should go ahead. This country already has a good railway system which with investment can be improved using existing lines. The HS2 project is a national issue so should be decided by us all.

attributes.action: To grant 6yr old epilepsy sufferer Alfie Dingley a licence for medical cannabis.
attributes.background: The Home Office need to act to grant 6yr old epilepsy sufferer Alfie Dingley a licence for medical cannabis. He was treated with it in Holland and his seizures reduced from 150 to 1 seizure a month. Alfie should not have to break the law to access his medicine. He needs this medicine to live.
attributes.additional_details: Alfie is 1 of 9 of nine boys in the world who suffer from PCH19. Without this licence from the Home Office to use medicinal cannabis Alfie's seizures will return to over 150 a month each requiring hospitalisation. He will not have the quality of life he deserves. The only treatment he responds to in the UK causes psychosis, organ damage and early death. The family should not have to accept this. The licence should be granted, Alfie is a patient not a criminal. He needs access to his medicine.

attributes.action: Animal abuse charges to be the same as human abuse charges
attributes.background: Murder is murder, assault is assault, physical abuse is physical abuse whether it is a human or an animal anyone found murdering or assaulting an animal should be punished the same as if they had murdered/assaulted a human to the maximum extent of the law.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of animals are killed murdered, brutally beaten, or left to starve to death. The sentencing for these offences is often a minimum Unlimited fine and/or 6 months. Help to stop animal suffering by signing our petition. 

Examples: - 
http://www.da4a.org/sport.htm
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/katy-gammon-solicitor-who-locked-3391542
https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/donald-trumps-son-game-hunting-photos/

attributes.action: Parliament to debate withdrawal of British support for Iran Nuclear deal.
attributes.background: On May 1st, BBC reported US response to Israel's claim of secret Iranian nuclear weapons factory hidden in Northern Syria, with the goal of producing 5 nuclear warheads. Israel presented evidence to show that Iran lied and defrauded the deal. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-43958205
attributes.additional_details: The Iran deal has produced great international controversy since its signature in 2015. To many, the very idea of bribing a terrorist-supporting state not to produce nuclear weapons has always been a dangerous nonsense. The British government talked a big talk against Russia with the Skripal poisoning, but seems completely blind to Iran's recklessly dangerous actions. This double standard needs be justified with full public parliamentary debate about withdrawing from the Iran deal.

attributes.action: Set up a National Register for carers  and Health Care Assistants
attributes.background: Families need to feel safe in the knowledge that carers who carry out work with the utmost trust need to belong on a national register.

attributes.action: Allow paganism to be taught in schools as part of the RE curriculum
attributes.background: Paganism is still being ignored by the curriculum despite being one of the oldest religions in the world and a religion from which many newer religions have borrowed traditions. Paganism is at the heart of British history and should be taught to allow understanding of our heritage to UK children.

attributes.action: Make "Jerusalem" England's official national anthem by law
attributes.background: Two years ago, a bill passed the first reading backing the call to consider an official national anthem for the nation of England to be played for major UK and Commonwealth events. This petition builds on that bill, and humbly asks to make 'Jerusalem' the official national anthem of England.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-derbyshire-35296296, "MPs back calls for English national anthem". BBC News. London: BBC. 13 January 2016.

https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2015-16/englishnationalanthem.html, English National Anthem Bill 2015-16.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rT1HEXNI9c4, 'Jerusalem', the song in question.

attributes.action: Undertake due diligence on Severn tolling to consider extending beyond end-2018
attributes.background: The abolition of the tolls will have serious economic consequences for the locality as resulting traffic growth impacts an already severely congested motorway network. A tolling extension will assist in the alleviation of congestion at little additional cost and aid WAG with relief road project time
attributes.additional_details: The M4 network in Wales is not equipped for the expected post-tolls traffic growth. Without the tolls ‘buffer’ any perceived financial boost to the economy will be effectively lost in the ensuing traffic chaos. The introduction of an extended tolling sliding scale regime (designed to collect 2018 tolls over 2018-2021) will have long lasting benefits. It will not compromise DfT debt recovery, end-users will not be financially disadvantaged, and it offers WAG a time extension for its relief scheme

attributes.action: Hold an independent inquiry Health Service settlements
attributes.background: It has been reported that Virgin Care were handed almost £2 million in an out of court settlement by Surrey’s Clinical Commissioning Groups, NHS England and Surrey County Council in 2017. This is a gross misuse of public money, but no-one has resigned or been held accountable.
attributes.additional_details: Lessons deserve to be learnt from such losses of public money.

attributes.action: Guarantee the right to remain in the UK of all Afghan interpreters
attributes.background: Afghan interpreters who served with the UK Armed Forces on Op HERRICK are currently at risk of deportation from the UK. If sent to Afghanistan they will likely be killed by the Taliban. We ask the Govt to grant Afghan interpreters and their families citizenship and the right to remain in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/news/afghan-interpreters-fear-being-sent-home-to-their-fate-under-visa-rules-0d7qdn8vr
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-manchester-43904806
https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/6198982/afghan-interpreters-uk-eviction-home-office-2400/

attributes.action: Ban disposable coffee cups as people are unaware of their impact on environment.
attributes.background: In the UK we use 7 million coffee cups every day. Even though coffee cups are classified as recyclable, only 1 per 400 cups is able to go through the recycling process the rest go into landfill due to the way they are manufactured. To protect our environment the government need to take action.
attributes.additional_details:
The action which could be taken would be for the government to look into Eco-friendly options to replace the coffee cup. 

The government also need to raise awareness to all consumers of disposable hot drinks, that, although they are supposed to be disposable, in reality very few are, because they cannot be recycled.

attributes.action: Revoke the Amendment to the Double Taxation Agreement (Article 18)  March 2018.
attributes.background:
We were in the Royal Air Force for just under 30 years.  We had met and holidayed in Cyprus towards the latter part of our service.
We decided that we would like to remain in Cyprus after our years were up.
The amended DTA would reduce the amount of household income Veterans' have to live on.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed amendment to the DTA, signed by both Governments in March 2018 (and yet to be passed by either parliament), proposes that from next year, Civil Service and Military Pensions will be taxed at source (the U.K.) and not as the majority of us arranged, when we decided to live and contribute here in Cyprus.

All we ask is that we can continue to live and contribute here with the same agreements in place from 1960, and even with Cyprus joining the E.U. in 2004.

attributes.action: Make the DVLA Vehicle Records and HPI records available to the public for FREE
attributes.background:
Fight for the freedom of information and the abuse by the current system forcing people to pay £20 to check a car for its records! 
All information should be free to the public including the details of the registered keepers. In many scenarios this free information could avoid a lot of difficulties
attributes.additional_details: It is unbelievable that the publics rights to freedom of information is In 2018 still being violated by the DVLA and car keeper details are still withheld from the public and kept secret only to be sold to third party companies [clamping and parking firms] (for £2.50 each check) it is absurd that these details should be held private and it shouldnt be any different than The Land Register that is available to the public. I don’t think I need to explain why all the HPI records should be free.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed changes to funding for refuges and short term housing.
attributes.background: These proposals will remove the only guaranteed funding for refuges from the welfare system. Effectively preventing vulnerable women from paying part of the cost of their accommodation in refuges with housing benefit resulting in mass closures of refuges.
attributes.additional_details: Funding for supported housing paragraph 68 on page 26 of the 58 page document details the proposed changes. Housing benefit currently meets about half of refuge funding resulting in closures of many.These changes withdraw all guaranteed funding for refuges for vulnerable women fleeing abuse putting them at further risk. Closures of refuges would result in enormous increased costs for alternative housing for local authorities.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory labelling for meat from animals reared with antibiotics.
attributes.background: Increasing bacterial antibiotic resistance is "one of the biggest threats to global health" (WHO). Agricultural use of antibiotics in the UK is decreasing (UK-VARSS), but knowledge of the threat to public health is limited. Labelling would increase knowledge and encourage consumer choice.
attributes.additional_details:
Awareness of the threat of antibiotic resistance is increasing. Public health measures to deal with it have focussed on correct use and prescription of therapeutic antibiotics. However, there is less knowledge of the threat posed by veterinary antibiotics.

A food labelling regime would raise awareness of this issue, and support the ongoing aim of reducing use. It also informs consumers about agricultural practice on imported food, which will be more important after Brexit.

attributes.action: Make school food-growing (and self-sufficiency) part of the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: All schools have space for growing food & with innovative techniques such as vertical gardening, even edges of a playground can become an allotment. Invest in schools so that they can REDUCE external dependency. Off-grid futures would incl. energy generation, rain-water harvesting & recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
The larger the space available, the larger the impact on education, health & school finances. It's also time to consider deleting meat from school meals, instead invest in growing fruit & veg.

Growing minds, building healthy futures, teaching valuable life-skills, helping children embrace the outdoors - growing food at school & learning about sustainability is fun, engaging & unforgettable, an essential subject for the National Curriculum.
